page.title: 17REDRUTH STATION
page.content:
REDRUTH RAILWAY STATION
REDRUTH RAILWAY STATION STANDS IN STATION HILL. IT WAS BUILT IN 1890 FOR THE GREAT WESTERN RAILWAY. FIFTY TRAINS GO THROUGH EACH DAY, BUT IN THE TOURIST SEASON AN EXTRA SIX TRAINS DAILY ARE PUT ON. FIVE HUNDRED PASSENGERS USE THE STATION EVERY DAY.ABOUT 280 TICKETS ARE SOLD DAILY.THE BUSIEST TIME IS 8 A.M. WHEN PEOPLE ARE GOING TO SCHOOL AND WORK.THE MOST POPULAR TRAIN AND THE FASTEST IS THE CORNISH RIVIERA EXPRESS, WHICH TRAVELS FROM LONDON. THE GOLDEN HIND IS ALSO POPULAR. ABOUT ONE TRAIN PER WEEK BREAKS DOWN AND CAUSES HOLDUPS.THE MOST VALUABLE FIND IN THE LOST PROPERTY OFFICE WAS A WALLET CONTAINING Â£500 AND A DIAMOND RING.
